intro: Cheilanthes kirkii, commonly known as the Kirk's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically dark green and leathery in texture. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to crevices in rock formations. Cheilanthes kirkii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its natural habitat.
